intro: Aotus carinata, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to cool, temperate climates. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, Aotus carinata is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation to extreme environments.
